comments.body: +9000 This is a much needed feature.
Joining the chorus...please add this capability so I can use one of my favorite tools, iftop. Thanks for your work on WSL!

Please add that support! That is very important for networking development. I cannot even use nmap to scan the network so that I can roughly see how my other device (i.e. Raspberry Pi) works. Sometimes I'd rather use Unix to develop the application since it can perfectly analog the scenario in Unix of other devices.
I also think that this will be an advantage in the development of IoT because most of them somehow need to be detected and used with AF_PACKET.
This should be fixed in WSL2 coming next month.

Signed up just to add my voice (and yes I upvoted actual ask) - almost all I do is based on around networking and would love to start using WSL more, but without this component it pretty much forces me away from WSL to less preferred alternatives.

>significant engineering effort
Wow. You call Ctrl+c and Ctrl+v like this?

Any resolution on this yet?
It's been more than a year and still there has been no resolution.
